author: kevaundray
content:
Hi, yes this is correct. If you are planning to only work on the trie logic, then those libraries are sufficient. They both rely on their respective cryptographic libraries, if you also plan to make changes to the cryptography.

There is also verkle_trie_eip in ethereum/research. Rust-verkle is interoperable with this proof of concept.

I am not sure if condrieu needs more testing nodes though note, condrieu is ran with only go-verkle nodes at the moment, there is an interoperability issue between rust-verkle and go-verkle, as go-verkle applies an optimisation that changes the proof format. See <https://github.com/crate-crypto/rust-verkle/issues/50>

You may also be able to contribute to what will soon be the reference implementation here: <https://github.com/crate-crypto/verkle-trie-ref> This is much slower and does not apply any unreadable optimisations, I'm currently adding the relevant code for IPA, so its still incomplete
